title: Gates Millennium Scholars Program
description: Provides full funding for minority students with high academic achievement.
about: Comprehensive support for undergraduate and graduate studies, including mentorship and leadership development.
eligibility: Minority students with high academic achievement
required: GPA 3.3+; U.S. citizenship; Pell Grant eligible; Leadership experience

title: Mastercard Foundation Scholars Program
description: Supports talented youth from economically disadvantaged backgrounds.
about: Partners with universities to offer full scholarships and leadership training.
eligibility: Strong academics; Financial need; Community service

title: Rhodes Scholarship
description: Prestigious award for postgraduate study at Oxford.
about: Selects students worldwide for academic excellence and leadership.
eligibility: Exceptional academics; Leadership; Service commitment

title: DAAD Scholarships for Development
description: German scholarships for students from developing countries.
about: Covers tuition, living costs, and travel for graduate studies in Germany.
eligibility: Developing country citizenship; Bachelor's degree; Work experience

title: Chevening Scholarships
description: UK government scholarships for global leaders.
about: Fully funded master's program with networking and leadership opportunities.
eligibility: Leadership potential; Undergraduate degree; English proficiency

title: Fulbright Foreign Student Program
description: U.S. scholarships for international graduate students.
about: Promotes mutual understanding through academic exchange.
eligibility: Non-U.S. citizens; Strong academics; Community engagement

title: Commonwealth Shared Scholarships
description: UK scholarships for students from low-income Commonwealth countries.
about: Supports master's degrees in development-related fields.
eligibility: Commonwealth citizenship; Financial need; Academic merit

title: AAUW International Fellowships
description: Supports women pursuing graduate studies in the U.S.
about: Encourages women from around the world to advance academically and professionally.
eligibility: Female; Non-U.S. citizen; Bachelor's degree

title: Google Generation Scholarship
description: Supports students pursuing computer science degrees.
about: Promotes diversity and inclusion in tech through financial aid and mentorship.
eligibility: Underrepresented groups in tech; Academic excellence

title: UNESCO-L’Oréal For Women in Science
description: Fellowships for women researchers in STEM.
about: Empowers women scientists through funding and global recognition.
eligibility: Female researchers in STEM; Strong research proposal

title: MTN Foundation Science & Technology Scholarship
description: Supports Nigerian students in science and technology fields.
about: Provides financial aid to high-performing students in public tertiary institutions across Nigeria, focusing on STEM disciplines.
eligibility: Nigerian citizenship; Enrolled in public university; STEM major

title: Knight-Hennessy Scholars Program
description: Stanford-based scholarship for global graduate students.
about: Offers full funding and leadership training for students pursuing graduate degrees at Stanford University.
eligibility: Strong academics; Leadership potential; Admission to Stanford

title: Jim Ovia Foundation Leaders Scholarship
description: Empowers young Africans through education.
about: Covers tuition and living expenses for undergraduate students in select African universities.
eligibility: African citizenship; Academic excellence; Leadership traits

title: Australia Awards Scholarships
description: Australian government scholarships for developing countries.
about: Supports postgraduate studies in Australia to build capacity and foster international cooperation.
eligibility: Citizens of eligible developing countries; Work experience

title: Shell Nigeria University Scholarship
description: Supports Nigerian students in tertiary institutions.
about: Annual scholarship for students in Nigerian universities studying engineering and sciences.
eligibility: Nigerian citizenship; Enrolled in accredited university; STEM field

title: Yale Young Global Scholars
description: Pre-college academic enrichment for high school students.
about: Two-week summer program at Yale University for outstanding high school students worldwide.
eligibility: Ages 15–18; Strong academics; English proficiency

title: Agbami Medical & Engineering Scholarship
description: Chevron-sponsored scholarship for Nigerian students.
about: Targets students in medicine and engineering disciplines in Nigerian universities.
eligibility: Nigerian citizenship; Medicine or engineering major

title: UNICEF Youth Education Grant
description: Supports youth-led education initiatives.
about: Funding for youth organizations or individuals promoting education access in underserved communities.
eligibility: Youth-led initiative; Education focus; Impact potential

title: Women Techmakers Scholarship
description: Google scholarship for women in tech.
about: Encourages women pursuing computer science degrees with financial support and community engagement.
eligibility: Female; Enrolled in CS program; Leadership potential

title: Tony Elumelu Foundation Entrepreneurship Program
description: Seed funding and training for African entrepreneurs.
about: Provides mentorship, business training, and $5000 seed capital to selected entrepreneurs.
eligibility: African citizenship; Business idea; Age 18–35
